info.title: ElevenLabs API Documentation
info.description:
This is the documentation for the ElevenLabs API. You can use this API to use our service programmatically, this is done by using your xi-api-key.
You can view your xi-api-key using the 'Profile' tab on https://beta.elevenlabs.io. Our API is experimental so all endpoints are subject to change.

get.description: Returns metadata about all your generated audio.

parameters.description: How many history items to return at maximum. Can not exceed 1000, defaults to 100.

schema.title: Page Size
schema.description: How many history items to return at maximum. Can not exceed 1000, defaults to 100.

parameters.name: page_size

parameters.description: After which history_item_id to start fetching, use this parameter to paginate across a large collection of history items. In case this parameter is not provided history items will be fetched starting from the most recently created one ordered descending by their creation date.

schema.title: Start After History Item Id
schema.description: After which history_item_id to start fetching, use this parameter to paginate across a large collection of history items. In case this parameter is not provided history items will be fetched starting from the most recently created one ordered descending by their creation date.

parameters.name: start_after_history_item_id

parameters.description: Your API key. This is required by most endpoints to access our API programatically. You can view your xi-api-key using the 'Profile' tab on the website.

post.description: Converts text into speech using a voice of your choice and returns audio.

parameters.description: Voice ID to be used, you can use https://api.elevenlabs.io/v1/voices to list all the available voices.

schema.title: Voice Id
schema.description: Voice ID to be used, you can use https://api.elevenlabs.io/v1/voices to list all the available voices.

parameters.name: voice_id

parameters.description:
You can turn on latency optimizations at some cost of quality. The best possible final latency varies by model. Possible values:
0 - default mode (no latency optimizations)
1 - normal latency optimizations (about 50% of possible latency improvement of option 3)
2 - strong latency optimizations (about 75% of possible latency improvement of option 3)
3 - max latency optimizations
4 - max latency optimizations, but also with text normalizer turned off for even more latency savings (best latency, but can mispronounce eg numbers and dates).

schema.title: How much we should optimize streaming request latency (time to first audio byte).
schema.description:
You can turn on latency optimizations at some cost of quality. The best possible final latency varies by model. Possible values:
0 - default mode (no latency optimizations)
1 - normal latency optimizations (about 50% of possible latency improvement of option 3)
2 - strong latency optimizations (about 75% of possible latency improvement of option 3)
3 - max latency optimizations
4 - max latency optimizations, but also with text normalizer turned off for even more latency savings (best latency, but can mispronounce eg numbers and dates).

parameters.name: optimize_streaming_latency

parameters.description:
You can turn on latency optimizations at some cost of quality. The best possible final latency varies by model. Possible values:
0 - default mode (no latency optimizations)
1 - normal latency optimizations (about 50% of possible latency improvement of option 3)
2 - strong latency optimizations (about 75% of possible latency improvement of option 3)
3 - max latency optimizations
4 - max latency optimizations, but also with text normalizer turned off for even more latency savings (best latency, but can mispronounce eg numbers and dates).

You can turn on latency optimizations at some cost of quality. The best possible final latency varies by model. Possible values:
0 - default mode (no latency optimizations)
1 - normal latency optimizations (about 50% of possible latency improvement of option 3)
2 - strong latency optimizations (about 75% of possible latency improvement of option 3)
3 - max latency optimizations
4 - max latency optimizations, but also with text normalizer turned off for even more latency savings (best latency, but can mispronounce eg numbers and dates).

get.description: Gets the default settings for voices. "similarity_boost" corresponds to"Clarity + Similarity Enhancement" in the web app and "stability" corresponds to "Stability" slider in the web app.
Returns the settings for a specific voice. "similarity_boost" corresponds to"Clarity + Similarity Enhancement" in the web app and "stability" corresponds to "Stability" slider in the web app.

schema.title: Response Get Models V1 Models Get

name.title: Name
name.description: The name that identifies this voice. This will be displayed in the dropdown of the website.

files.title: Files
files.description: One or more audio files to clone the voice from

description.title: Description
description.description: How would you describe the voice?

labels.title: Labels
labels.description: Serialized labels dictionary for the voice.

history_item_ids.title: History Item Ids
history_item_ids.description: A list of history items to download, you can get IDs of history items and other metadata using the GET https://api.elevenlabs.io/v1/history endpoint.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name that identifies this voice. This will be displayed in the dropdown of the website.

files.title: Files
files.description: Audio files to add to the voice

description.title: Description
description.description: How would you describe the voice?

labels.title: Labels
labels.description: Serialized labels dictionary for the voice.

text.title: Text
text.description: The text that will get converted into speech.

model_id.title: Model Id
model_id.description: Identifier of the model that will be used, you can query them using GET /v1/models.

voice_settings.title: Voice Settings
voice_settings.description: Voice settings overriding stored setttings for the given voice. They are applied only on the given TTS request.

text.title: Text
text.description: The text that will get converted into speech.

model_id.title: Model Id
model_id.description: Identifier of the model that will be used, you can query them using GET /v1/models.

voice_settings.title: Voice Settings
voice_settings.description: Voice settings overriding stored setttings for the given voice. They are applied only on the given TTS request.

tags.name: models
tags.description: Access the different models of the platform.

tags.name: voices
tags.description: Access to voices created either by you or us.

tags.name: samples
tags.description: Access to your samples. A sample is any audio file you attached to a voice. A voice can have one or more samples.

tags.name: history
tags.description: Accesses your history. Your history is a list of all your created audio including its metadata.
